title: I Like Making Toast
body:
I was an avid gamer when I was young (born in 82), but these days most games are all flash and no substance.

I can play modern Xbox or PSwhatevernumber games, and they tend to be terrible. Back in the 80's-90's it was all about gameplay, not stupid graphics, video scenes, fancy voice overs, etc.

I play LoL on a fucking toaster. 2.4GHz processor, 2 GB RAM, no graphics card... integrated graphics.
This is toaster as fuck, and I can still get S grades.

I just have a value system where I would rather buy a new guitar/amp than a new PC, because, well, rocking out>nerding out.
It does cause me issues in game from time to time (certain skins kill my fps), but that's poor coding from Riot, not my fault.

I can carry and get S grades at 20 fps, report me for making the toast.

I used to play on a better PC, but it died and I had better priorities for my money than gaming.
Shout out if you make the toast on LoL.

replies.body: You do not carry on 20 fps. Literally unplayable.

20 fps is doable, did it for a while myself. I don't think I could go back from 100 now, at the very least not without a long adjustment period, but it's not unplayable. If it's what you're used to, it's at most a little uncomfortable or unresponsive to play.

Yeah whatever you say mate you're full of crap. Anyone who plays on 20 fps will adjust to 100 after one game, anyone who plays on 100+ will not be able to adjust to 20 fps. It literally screws with your brain. Not only that but you wont be reacting faster than other players. Its not to say your bad at the game but if you're playing ranked there's no way you're going to carrying with an s rank on 20 fps.

Please... I've also played on both 20 & 200fps and although I much prefer 200fps at maximum fidelity, 20fps on low is still doable. In fact, every time I reinstall league, I have to remember to reset the fps limit because it is automatically set fairly low. When I first started playing league there wasn't any mastery or in game history but I'm 100% certain I would have had a bunch of S+ games then. Back when it was farm lane until 20 mins then teamfight... The good old days.

Back to OP - I never played league on a absolutely toast machine for too long but prior to league I used to play WOW on a real toast of a laptop because my tower couldn't run it. Then eventually I managed to install a private server on the same laptop. 5 FPS was good on that.

Also on my previous laptop during WOW raid boss fights, on low my FPS used to drop to 1 frame per 3 seconds during intense moments. That was almost unplayable, almost.
Ok so you know you can't play with 20 fps I guess, doesn't mean noone else can.

I still play (modded) Diablo 2 regularly (Median). That's now 17 years old (D2, Median is only about 10 years old), and still one of the best games around.
There are probably more people playing mods of D2 than there are playing D3, lmao.

I also periodically go into retro gaming phases, where I use emulators to replay all the games I grew up with in the 80's/90's.

Mmm DIablo 2, now that brings back memories. One of the first LAN games I played :P 

Still play Kirby 64 every now and again too.

I hit Diamond 1 on 300 ping.

Wtf is this low-quality bragging thread.

I quite enjoyed the new AC (despite not enjoying any other past brotherhood) but really it's more for the gameplay and not the story. The story wasn't bad, but it wasn't exactly great either. Not super deep and pretty cliche which is fine every now and again but not all the time. 

I'm keen to try Monster Hunter, don't know if it'll be my kinda game but at least it's something different (for me anyway as I never had it on Nintendo anything), and I've heard many many good things about Horizon. Beyond that, there really isn't much I'd put very high at all on my list of games I want to play PS wise.

Lost Sphear looked interesting but got some pretty average reviews so I'll probs give it a pass, at least until it's dirt cheap.

I'm definitely a lover of good visuals, but I definitely agree that they shouldn't be the main focus (even if I hold them higher than most). It doesn't have to be hyper realistic to look nice. Journey was a gorgeous game, but also simplistic. Cuphead was made by a tiny ass team and has hella unique visuals. You don't and shouldn't ever need a big budget, or to forget about the rest of the game to make the game look good.

On a side note, if you liked the old Sega games, I found out the other day you can actually use the old cartridges in the Mega Drive that was released recently so you're not just limited to the games pre-installed which is nice, and they're not all that expensive (under 200) relatively speaking.

>I'm definitely a lover of good visuals, but I definitely agree that they shouldn't be the main focus (even if I hold them higher than most). It doesn't have to be hyper realistic to look nice. Journey was a gorgeous game, but also simplistic. Cuphead was made by a tiny ass team and has hella unique visuals. You don't and shouldn't ever need a big budget, or to forget about the rest of the game to make the game look good.

Yeah i think the whole issue is the gaming company standard is massive AAA game put all the money in and because we spent so much money, micro-transactions out the ass etc. and i really wish companies would just realise, the thing they need to change is the budget, not the Profit line.

Good Graphics doesn't require 2 hours on one butt cheek (even though sometimes that is how it feels like it's done).

>I'm keen to try Monster Hunter

I've been considering getting it, i'm just a bit iffy about how apparently "new player friendly" the game seems to have taken the path, it was a hard game to get into, but it was kinda one that was worth the effort in the end (at least from the ones i had played)

Though that said i'm waiting to see a few more reviews before i make up my mind.

Yeah I haven't really heard much about Monster Hunter yet at work in the game place, though I've only worked twice since it came out. That said, we haven't had any returns yet (like we did for say, Agents of Mayhem or Elex) and we're completely sold out, so people can't be hating it.

For me the new player friendly is obviously a bonus, since the lack of was one of the things that put me off initially (small budget for games means not sure is a no buy), but for returning players I can understand it might be concerning. Time will tell I suppose.

>I can play modern Xbox or PSwhatevernumber games, and they tend to be terrible. Back in the 80's-90's it was all about gameplay, not stupid graphics, video scenes, fancy voice overs, etc.

I feel you man, these new games are all in on the graphics, but the story/gameplay is ass and never the focus anymore.

It's the reason i still play FF7/8/10, because these were the games before it was all about the graphics (remember when those ugly pixels were revolutionary?)

Indie games tend to hit that niche of being good outside the graphics, and i haven't bought a proper game in years
